title: A1706 Power OK, Critical Software Update fail, Touchbar not working
message:
Hi guys,

as in the Title the MacBook does turn un but requires to connect to a Wifi. After that it tries to install something and aborts it.

I somehow managed it to boot into MacOS via Holding down Shift left. Then the Macbook started to let me go trough the "first installation cycle". It was VERY slow. And by VERY slow i mean VERY VERY slow. After first installation and adding user and stuff i noticed that the TouchBar did not work.

Could you give me some advice what to do next ?

Greetings and many Thanks in Advance !

title: A1706 Power OK, Critical Software Update fail, Touchbar not working
message:
You've started in safe mode and touchbar driver wasn't loaded.

Start in diagnostic mode and see if any error pops up.

title: A1706 Power OK, Critical Software Update fail, Touchbar not working
message:
Thanks for your answer. I need to wait for a new Power Button because customer tried to remove board by himself and damaged it during this process.
If i know any further info about Diagnostics i will continue this thread !:) Thanks !!!

title: A1706 Power OK, Critical Software Update fail, Touchbar not working
message: You can use SMC_ONOFF_L pads from the board, instead of power button.

title: A1706 Power OK, Critical Software Update fail, Touchbar not working
message: Okay tried this and booted it up in Diagnostics Mode. VDH002 is the Error shown up.

title: A1706 Power OK, Critical Software Update fail, Touchbar not working
message:
Apple says something about storage device.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT203747[/URL]

Disconnect internal LCD and test with external monitor.
Or just disconnect webcam from T-CON and test with internal LCD.

You can also start in Target Disk mode and check the SSD integrity from other machine.

title: A1706 Power OK, Critical Software Update fail, Touchbar not working
message:
But what has Webcam and LCD to do with internal storage?

In target Disc Mode the SSD does not appear on another Device.

title: A1706 Power OK, Critical Software Update fail, Touchbar not working
message:
Bad ALS can cause the critical update error.
Is basic to test disconnecting the webcam in such case.

Did you try another connection cable?
Also try connecting on all USB-C ports.

USB macOS works good?

title: A1706 Power OK, Critical Software Update fail, Touchbar not working
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 84983, member: 682"]
Bad ALS can cause the critical update error.
Is basic to test disconnecting the webcam in such case.

Did you try another connection cable?
Also try connecting on all USB-C ports.

USB macOS works good?
[/QUOTE]

Could you tell me how to only disconnect the Webcam seperately ?

title: A1706 Power OK, Critical Software Update fail, Touchbar not working
message:
On the T-CON board, one of the small connectors (at right of LCD connector), is for webcam.

Please, do not quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above...

title: A1706 Power OK, Critical Software Update fail, Touchbar not working
message: Okay sorry - will try this solution tomorrow !:)
